title: (13597) Puertollano - Unnamed Road

Start for mountain biking and hiking routes. It is located at the gates of the Valle de Alcudia and Sierra Madrona Natural Park. All services are price paid at an ATM.

title: (13440) Argamasilla de Calatrava - 10 Glorieta Navarra
description: Comfortable place to do laundry, very easy to park, it has a washing machine for our pets' clothes. While you can enjoy tapas from La Mancha, if it's Saturday you can try their famous Migas.

title: (13592) Mestanza - 13D Calle la Fuente M
description: Parking near a public park, next to a covered track that is used for the town festivals, there is no sign that prevents parking, a street with very little traffic, there is a water tap and garbage cans, a small park for children's games and a football field. The surroundings of Mestanza have a very interesting landscape, especially in spring and autumn.

title: (13592) Mestanza - 22 Calle del Charco M

title: (13590) Hinojosas de Calatrava -

So at your own risk? The way there is a few kilometers of gravel road. Not so pleasant to drive, but doable for all mobile I think.

title: (13440) Argamasilla de Calatrava - Unnamed Road
description: Spot away to spend a night. Accessible by a motorable track.

title: (13592) Mestanza - Unnamed Road
description: Parking at the entrance to the Puertollano treatment plant is located on a hill with a beautiful view of the entire Montoro reservoir. Access is via a paved road with a very good firm and narrow path. There is no indication to reach it.

title: (13592) Mestanza -
description: Spot in the middle of nature. We parked between cows. Good views of the swamp. No coverage.

title: (13450) Brazatortas - 42 Calle Pozo

title: (13593) Hinojosas de Calatrava - Camino de Tablillas
title_short: (13593) Hinojosas de Calatrava - Camino de Tablillas
description: Great place! Very lonely and hidden directly from a lake. We stayed 2 nights, no problems! Only the last piece is 4x4 but there are other options without four-wheel drive.

title: (13190) Corral de Calatrava - Calle Almadén
description: A picnic / rest area with a pond, very quiet and pleasant. There is 4g network and the city is not far. There are free services and tables under the trees.

title: (13190) Corral de Calatrava - 1 Calle Chopos
description: It is an area located near Corral de Calatrava. Hiking trails, bicycle trails, Camino de Guadalupe and Ruta del Quixote, swimming pool with restaurant with children's area, sports center and paddle tennis court 50m away. The town is a 1 minute walk where there are neighborhood shops, restaurants, tapas bars, bakery, etc. There is also a natural area with barbecues and tables, a pond with ducks and drinking water and where you can sleep.

title: (13192) Cabezarados -
description: Perfect spot for the night - some road noise, at night quiet. No facilities.

title: (13380) - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of the castle of Calatrava. ATTENTION: Only from the afternoon of Sunday to Tuesday morning, since the castle closes on Monday.The rest of the days are usually full during the day, although late in the afternoon any day is good. The views are simply spectacular. Without any service except the bin.

title: (13431) Villar del Pozo - Unnamed road
description: Streets without buildings, there is no traffic, a spacious and safe place, there is no shade, a stream runs nearby, the airport is for logistics use. Perfect place to let your dog loose.

title: (13593) Solana del Pino -
description: Helipad level esplanade and behind the cemetery. Next to the town. Good starting point for excursions and as a base to get to know the Valle de Alcudia and Sierra Madrona natural park. You go down a paved road in good condition. At the beginning of this street there are garbage cans and a fountain. In the village bakery, butcher, honey, bars. The town wants motorhome tourism, please respect the parking area.

title: (13593) Solana del Pino - Calle Primero de Mayo
title_short: (13593) Solana del Pino - Calle Primero de Mayo
description: Nice parking and free night for 8 motorhomes, in a natural point of view with a fantastic view of the Sierra Madrona, located near the municipal swimming pool. A wonder to enjoy the nature of the Alcudia Valley and the Sierra Madrona Natural Park

title: (13380) Aldea del Rey - 11 Calle Nueva Apertura E
title_short: (13380) Aldea del Rey - 11 Calle Nueva Apertura E
description: Inaugurated in June 2021. Automated access and service contract (electricity, water change and showers/WC) and payment for each one separately. It only accepts credit card payment. Beautiful surroundings, the shade growing and the pleasant town. Maximum stay 48 hours

title: (13594) Solanilla del Tamaral -
description: Nice location along a quiet road and one of the few suitable locations in this area to stay in your vehicle. along running water against a slope where the red deer and mountain goats come to eat in the evening and morning. no facilities and no internet coverage.

title: (14449) El Horcajo - Cam del Robledillo a Fuencaliente
title_short: (14449) El Horcajo - Cam del Robledillo a Fuencaliente
description: Quiet place surrounded by nature No services Ideal for nature lovers and hikers Very little traffic on the road Altitude 742 meters Accessible to any size motorhome with trailer or heavy goods vehicles The Guardia Civil passes no problem

title: (13370) Aldea del Rey - Unnamed Road
description: Small car park located behind the dam of the Jabalón Reservoir. Level asphalt floor. It does not have a garbage deposit but it exists at the deviation of the access road 2.0 km.

title: (13370) Calzada de Calatrava - 166 Calle Cervantes
description: Parking in the street, without problems, in front of one of the most beautiful painted silos of the Titanes project. Quiet place, although on business days it can be a bit noisy because there is a school in front.

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - Camino de Ventillas
description: Pleasant place easy to access by track 8 picnic tables in the woods and fountain / source good flow almost flat area for 3/4 motorhomes ideal for dogs. Forbidden at night

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - 110 N-420
description: Roadside stop with shade

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - N-420
description: Recreation area with drinking water, a stream, tables and many trees.

name: Área de autocaravanas automática
title: (13130) Área de autocaravanas automática
description: Automatic motorhome area. It is similar to those that exist in the community of Castilla la Mancha. You have access by credit card. The water change is paid separately and the bathrooms and toilets are also paid separately. The 14 seats are somewhat uneven but with fixing chocks. There are different routes that can be consulted on the website of the Fuencaliente town hall.

title: (13594) Solanilla del Tamaral -
description: Small hiking trail parking lot, next to a road with very little traffic. Nice views and possibility to spend the night.

title: (13130) Fuencaliente -
description: Parking Shelter of Peña Escrita. Ideal to start routes and visit the cave paintings. Access is by a narrow and continuous road along an unpaved road. Note on the routes: During the high fire danger season (June 1 - September 30), access will be subject to the sectoral legislation in this regard.

title: (13195) Poblete -
description: Small place to stop. A small river below. And room for a van. I indicate it because not so easy to stop in Spain

title: (13195) Valverde -
description: Parking of the famous castle of Alarcón and its battle, has a route that through QR code tells you the history of the battle from the nearby town of Poblete. The parking lot is quiet with plenty of shade, there is a water fountain nearby and toilets, which are occasionally open... impressive views of both the castle and De la Vega of the Guadiana river, nearby are hiking trails to Valverde and its lagoon for example! A good place to spend the night, we went in the van, and everything was perfect.

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic picnic with water fountain next to the Fuencaliente soccer field. Very quiet place

title: (13005) Ciudad Real - 284 Poblado Poblachuela Anj
description: Church surrounded by a park with shaded stone benches with soccer field and two drinking fountains. Ideal to stop to rest and eat. With an esplanade next to parking.

title: (13596) Almodóvar del Campo - 7 Calle la Bienvenida
title_short: (13596) Almodóvar del Campo - 7 Calle la Bienvenida

title: (13360) Granátula de Calatrava - 9 Calle Piscina
description: Located at the entrance of Granatula de Calatrava, with very easy access, it is the access to the public swimming pool, very wide and with easy parking. At about 300 meters at the bus stop you can recharge water at a tap for public use at no cost

title: (13360) Granátula de Calatrava - 3 CR-P-5225
description: Only one parking space nearby. Parking strips next to the road. Very quiet.

title: (13360) Granátula de Calatrava - Cam. de la Aldea del Rey
title_short: (13360) Granátula de Calatrava - Cam. de la Aldea del Rey
description: Very quiet car park day/night. Gravel and asphalt leveling. To sleep you don't hear anything except the sound of nature. Next to an archaeological site of good cultural tourist interest and a Roman bridge (Publio baebio). It has a playground, picnic areas and garbage containers. The town is 4 km away and has all the services (pharmacies, bakeries, bars, tobacconists, grocery stores, banks). The environment is surrounded by olive and almond trees.

title_short: (13005) Ciudad Real - 1 Calle Futura Ronda Uealb 1

title: (13005) Ciudad Real - 2 Calle Arándano
description: Very quiet parking where you sleep. Free and without prohibitions. Large.

title: (23740) Andújar - A-6178
description: Small clearing along the road without traffic (2 cars in 10h). Important presence of deer that can be observed at any time of the day. A delight.

title: (13108) Luciana - 16 Paseo Eucaliptos
description: Great place near the Guadiana river, with picnic tables, barbecues and garbage cans. No water on site but you have a fountain at 100m. Perfect to stay 1 night in the tranquility of nature. Many locals come here for a walk or for fishing. Cats in the wild.

title: (13005) Ciudad Real - 6B Calle Tomelloso
description: Battery parking next to a park with benches and snacks, quiet place with a pine park, and in front of an ALDI for last minute purchases.

title: (13002) Ciudad Real - 2A Avenida Descubrimiento de América
title_short: (13002) Ciudad Real - 2A Avenida Descubrimiento de América

title_short: (13004) Ciudad Real - Calle Eras del Cerrillo

title: (13004) Ciudad Real -

title: (13100) Piedrabuena -
description: Super nice place to quietly experience the sunset and sunrise. There is space for 5 campers with lots of open space. Ideal place for a hike. A few meters up the mountain there is a small church with a great view of the valley and the village. Please always take your rubbish with you, or put it in a rubbish bin like here.

title: (13005) Ciudad Real - 20 Calle Doctor Fleming

It has hermitage, place of pilgrimage

title: (13005) Ciudad Real - 45 Calle Osa Menor
description: It is opposite the cemetery. At least today, Sunday there is not a car. And just opposite is a residential area of ​​terraced houses. It can be either directly in front of the cemetery or under the trees. To stay overnight without noise and without problems. But only parking and overnight. Camping no.

title: (13170) Miguelturra - 25 Calle Sara Montiel
description: Next to hermitage of San Isidro, quiet area to sleep, with plenty of shade. Above there are picnic areas.

title: (13005) Ciudad Real - Calle Sol
description: Very comfortable and quiet place to spend the night. Ideal for those who travel with children since there is a large park directly opposite. Meeting place of the people of the area, because when we arrived they were eating on the lawn areas that surround the park. Extensive site to walk with pets.

title: (13100) Piedrabuena - 23 Avenida Yedra
description: Table of the Yedra. Nice place on the banks of the Bullaque River. with wooden tables and barbecue for picnic. camping is prohibited and making fires. No one bothered us. the only drawback is that in summer people come to dinner at the wooden tables and they may bother if you want to go to bed soon. We move away a little and without problem. The place is worth it. In summer it has a beach bar to eat or drink something very well priced.

title: (13270) Almagro - 2 Calle David Rayo
description: At the entrance of Almagro small parking ideal for visiting the city. 5 minutes walk from the magnificent plaza major and the corral de comedias (17th century open-air theater).

title: (13005) Ciudad Real - P-2112
description: Atalaya forest area. About 5 km from Ciudad Real. No services. With fountain next to the parking lot. Perfect to come with dogs and / or children. Routes on foot and mountain bike. Shaded picnic area and swings. Parking with little crowded car spaces. Garbage containers in the area. For medium / small motorhomes and camper

title: (13270) Almagro - 2D Calle Rastro de San Juan
title_short: (13270) Almagro - 2D Calle Rastro de San Juan

title: (13270) Almagro - 0 Calle Chile

title: (13270) Almagro - 47 Calle Ejido de San Juan
title_short: (13270) Almagro - 47 Calle Ejido de San Juan
description: Wide and shady side of the street. Gas station nearby. Easy access. Level.

title: (13270) Almagro - 1 Calle Ejido de Calatrava
description: Parking on the square, next to the visitor center

name: Camping Los Arenales Almagro
title: (13270) Camping Los Arenales Almagro
description: Well located very shady place with big trees. The place has a lot of potential which unfortunately is not used. Sanitary okay, plots partly dirty and neglected. Cafeteria permanently closed, restaurants closed (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday...). Nice pool with bar (bar very expensive). Bread service was offered but didn't take place the next morning. In this condition, the place is only suitable for transit as a self-catering.

title: (14447) Azuel - 6 A-3200
description: Small parking, 2 places, concrete, lighted, very quiet. We had a peaceful night there.

title: (14447) Azuel - 22 Calle de Bellavista
description: Viewpoint from the Cerro de los Tomillos. A great place to spend the day and night, it has several picnic tables. There are no services, electricity, water, public lighting, etc. It is reached by crossing the narrow town and going up a dirt road with a fair-bad surface.

title: (14448) Conquista - 11 Calle Barrio Estacion
description: Free parking with a small water fountain, very quiet village, facing the municipal swimming pool. Perfect for a quiet night's sleep. Right next to a road but almost no passage (village of 400 people)

title: (13140) Peralvillo - Unnamed Road
description: 12 km from Ciudad Real, around the lake, surrounded by nature, bird watching. Parking is possible during the day, no sign prohibiting the night.

title: (13140) Miguelturra - 41 Poblado Peralvillo
description: Service area for motorhomes of the town hall

title: (13140) Peralvillo -
description: Level grass field. 100 meters further is a picnic area with tables and benches. The parking lots are very sloping there.

title: (14446) El Cerezo - 1 Diseminado Cerezo
description: Fantastic site, the village the cherry tree. Starting point to visit places among wolves

title: (13160) - 20 Avenida Campo de Calatrava
description: However, this location is well signposted for the village. The panel looks very neat and the amenities are there as they should be. Fill in water, discharge waste water and electricity is switched off, washing dishes everything is possible! beautiful concrete slab with enough space!

title: (23214) El Centenillo -
description: Viewpoint in natural park. all the environmental agents who have stopped have a very pleasant treatment. parking is allowed, NO camping, please be respectful so we can continue to use this site.

title: (14445) Cardeña - 59 Calle Duquesa de la Vega Pozo
title_short: (14445) Cardeña - 59 Calle Duquesa de la Vega Pozo
description: Places to picnic with tables, trash bins near astronomical observatory.

name: Centro de Visitantes Venta Nueva | Cardeña
title: (14445) Centro de Visitantes Venta Nueva | Cardeña
title_short: (14445) Centro de Visitantes Venta Nueva | Cardeña

title: (13150) Carrión de Calatrava - Carretera de la Virgen
title_short: (13150) Carrión de Calatrava - Carretera de la Virgen
description: Virgin of the Incarnation Huge picnic area with toilets and water (not drinkable?)

title: (13150) Carrión de Calatrava - Carretera de la Virgen
title_short: (13150) Carrión de Calatrava - Carretera de la Virgen
description: Parking Calatrava la Vieja. Parking very quiet, only with the sound of birds. Far from the municipality. Ideal for visiting the archaeological site. There is a toilet and a fountain in the enclosure.

title: (23740) Andújar - JF-5004
description: Parking at the end of La Lancha road (gravel and potholed but drivable) famous among lynx watchers. The parking is right by the dam so expect some gentle noise at night. Good shade in the afternoon from big eucalyptus trees. The parking is quite popular during the weekends but nobody stayed overnight in March. We have a pleasant week there without problems. A nice short walk starts right from the parking - good for birdwatching and watching ibex up the rocks. For birdwatching, you can also cross the dam and walk along the road. There are turtles in the lake. If you are in this area for lynx watching this is a perfect place for a night. Just 15 minutes drive back in the direction of farms and the main road there are three lookouts to observe lynxes (if you are lucky). We saw only one during our week-long stay. Other wildlife such as red deers, fallow deers, mouflons are present. Spanish imperial eagle is possible too from the lookouts. Definitely, a perfect place for a prolonged stay, especially if you are a nature lover. The parking is spacey enough even for several big motorhomes. There are no services, no source of water and no rubbish bin. You have to be fully self-sufficient to enjoy this place.

title: (13120) Porzuna - 2A Avenida del Doctor Garrido
description: Overnight area under construction process. Municipal swimming pool can be used at 100m

name: Mirador del embalse del Jándula
title: (23748) Mirador del embalse del Jándula
description:
A stunning space for up to 3 vans.  A peaceful and tranquil stay immersed in nature with Eagles and Vultures flying overhead and the opportunity to spot Lnyx and Deer. 
It is at the end of a 10KM rough track but the vista is worth every bump. 
The reason why we camp offgrid.

No water or bins so you bring what you need and take home what you used. 

Popular are for fishing and wildlife spotting.

title: (13128) Porzuna - CR-P-7222
description: Public park next to the river with the possibility of bathing. Quiet in winter or on weekdays.
